title: Nsil1-Msp1 RAD-digest Detailed Protocol

source.title: Adapter Suspension, Dilution, Annealing and Working Stock

source.description: Suspend lyophilized single stranded adapters to final stock concentration of 100µM in 1XEB.

source.body:
-Adapter 1 top and bottom will be combined in plate format. Each well corresponding to an individual adapter.
-Adapter 2 top and bottom will be combined in strip tubes.
-Final Working Stock will contain 0.02µM Adapter

source.description:
Make 100µL of 10µM double stranded adapter.
____________________

source.body: Repeat this step for both Adapter 1 and Adapter 2.

source.description: Place top and bottom Adapter 1 mixture onto the Thermocycler and run "RAD Anneal" program.
Check the annealed adapters with the Qubit.

Dilute Adapter 1 from 10µM to 3µM.
____________________
Adapter 2 will remain at 10µM and can be stored at 4°C.
Normalize Adapter 1 to 2.2ng/µL (0.1µM) and store at 4°C.

Create a100µLof  "Working Adapter Stock".
____________________
Seal plate, vortex and spin down before storing at 4°C until used.
Quantify genomic DNA to ensure samples contain between 20ng/µL and 150ng/µL.

source.body: Genomic DNA is selected based on gel electrophoresis and Qubit results.

source.description: Create a 30µL aliquot of 20ng/µL genomic DNA using AE Buffer as diluent.
Store at 4° unti used.

Create Restriction Master Mix:
Per reaction:
____________________
Add 10µL of Restriction Master Mix to each well.
Add 10µL of 20ng/µL genomic DNA sample to the Restriction Master Mix.
Seal plate and run "RAD-digest" PCR program.
Proceed directly to ligation step.

Create Ligation Master Mix:
Per reaction:
____________________
Add 5µL of Adapter Working Stock to the 20µL restriction digest product.
Add 15µL of Ligation Master Mix to the 25µL of working adapter and restriction digest product.
Seal plate and run "RAD-ligation" PCR program.
Ligated DNA stored at 4°C until use.
Pool 5µL of each sample into a single tube.

Perform a column clean-up with QIAquick PCR Purification Kit. 
  1. Calculate the volume of pooled sample. 
  2. Add 5 volumes of PB to sample.
  3. Transfer 600µL to filter column and spin at 17,900g for 1 minute.
  4. Discard flow-through and add second 600µL aliquot to filter column before spinning at 17,900 for 1 minute. 
  5. Discard flow-through, add 750µL of PE  and spin at 17,900g for 1 minute. 
  6. Discard flow-through and spin empty column at 17,900g for 1 minute.
  7. Discard flow-through and transfer filter column to new (pre-labelled) epi tube.
  8. Add 60µL of EB to the center of the membrane before spinning at 17,900g for 1 minute.
  9. Keep flow-through and store at 4°C until size select.
Transfer 30µL of sample to a clean epi.
Add 10µL of Pippin Loading Solution (stored at 4°C)
Turn on the Pippin Prep
Perform and optical calibration.
Navigate to the main menu on the Pippin and select the most recent run from the drop down menu.
Create a new program by navigating to the Protocol Editor and altering the lane numbers.
Enter range values in the "BP Start" and "BP End" as 200-350bp respectively.
Select "USE INTERNAL STANDARDS" before saving the protocol under the current date.
Prepare the cassette by dislodging all bubbles behind the elution wells and filling any low reservoirs with electrophoresis buffer.
Remove 40µL of the buffer from the elution well and refill with fresh buffer before covering the wells with tape.
Remove 40µL of electrophoresis buffer from the sample well and replace with 40µL of sample. Repeat for remaning samples.
Perform continuity test.
Press "Start"
Once the run is complete, remove tape from elution wells and retreive 40µL of sample from the well. Repeat for all samples.
Remove the cassette from the optical nest. Cover all the wells with aluminum tape.
Fill rinse cassette with ddH20, place it in the cassette and close lid.
Allow probes to incubate for one minute. Discard the water and allow cassette to dry before storing.

Prepare Amplification Master Mix:
Per reaction:
____________________

source.body: -Each multiplexed sample are run in quadruplicate.

source.description: Add 5µL of size selected sample to 20µL aliquot of PCR Master Mix.
Run "RAD-amplification" program.
Pool all four PCR library replicates.

Perform a column clean-up with QIAquick PCR Purification Kit
  1. Calculate the volume of pooled sample. 
  2. Add 5 volumes of PB to sample.
  3. Transfer 600µL to filter column and spin at 17,900g for 1 minute. 
  4. Discard flow-through, add 750µL of PE  and spin at 17,900g for 1 minute. 
  5. Discard flow-through and spin empty column at 17,900g for 1 minute.
  6. Discard flow-through and transfer filter column to new (pre-labelled) epi tube.
  7. Add 50µL of EB to the center of the membrane before spinning at 17,900g for 1 minute.
  8. Keep flow-through and store at 4°C until size select.
Create a 30µL aliquot to 200pM samole for processing on the Ion Chef.
Store all plates and sample pools at -20°C for long term storage.

materials.name: Pippin Prep Dye-Free Cassettes and Associated Solutions and Buffers

description:
This protocol comes with no guarantees, and is primarily used for the authors’ purposes. This protocol is an adaptation from the work in the following publications:
Mascher M, Wu S, Amand PS, Stein N, Poland J (2013) Application of Genotyping-by-Sequencing on Semiconductor Sequencing Platforms: A Comparison of Genetic and Reference-Based Marker Ordering in Barley. PLoS ONE 8(10): e76925. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0076925
Recknagel, H.,Jacobs, A.,Herzyk, P., &Elmer, K. R.(2015).Double‐digest RAD sequencing using ion proton semiconductor platform (ddRADseq‐ion) with nonmodel organisms.Molecular Ecology Resources,15,1316–1329.https://doi.org/10.1111/1755-0998.12406
